preambula:
We created this short test to help you understand where your inner support is now, and where tension may have accumulated.

It's based on proven psychological methods adapted to real male situations — without clinical labels or unnecessary philosophy.

It takes 5–7 minutes to complete, and the results will help select self-help cards that are right for you.
instruction:
Answer honestly and spontaneously — there are no "right" answers here.

If you're not sure — choose what feels closer to your overall feelings, not to individual days.

It's better not to analyze, but to feel. Just assess how much the statement resembles your life right now.

There are about 30 questions, it will take 5–7 minutes.

At the end, you'll get an emotional map — we'll show which topics are most relevant now and suggest exercises that may help.

This is not a medical test, not a diagnosis, and not a label. It's a tool to better understand yourself and notice when you should give yourself a break.

questions.text: Lately I feel tired even from familiar tasks.
I find it hard to relax, even when I have time to rest.
Work or household tasks seem excessively difficult to me.
I feel like I'm "working on autopilot".
I increasingly feel irritation or apathy without reason.
I often feel anxious about the future or finances.
I replay the same anxious thoughts.
I doubt my decisions, even if they are logical.
I avoid situations where I might make a mistake or be judged.
I feel physical tension when thinking about problems.
I find it difficult to openly talk about my feelings.
I often feel misunderstood by loved ones.
Conflicts repeat for the same reasons.
I avoid conversations to avoid escalating the situation.
I feel lonely, even when others are nearby.
I feel like I'm not successful enough.
I often compare myself to others.
I doubt my value as a person.
I find it difficult to accept compliments.
I feel like I've lost connection with myself and my desires.
I easily get irritated by small things.
Sometimes I feel like I "explode" suddenly.
I'm angry at myself for not controlling my emotions.
After outbursts of irritation, I feel guilty.
I often notice inner tension, even without a reason.
I feel a loss of interest in what used to bring joy.
In the morning, it's hard for me to get up and start the day.
I find it difficult to concentrate even on simple tasks.
I feel emptiness or hopelessness.
I feel like my efforts don't make sense.
